trans-unit.source: Associates a security action with a custom security attribute.
This type is deprecated and will be removed in a future version of the .NET Framework.
For more information, see [Oracle and ADO.NET](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/oracle-and-adonet.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OraclePermissionAttribute"></xref> class.
One of the <xref href="System.Security.Permissions.SecurityAction"></xref> values representing an action that can be performed using declarative security.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether a blank password is allowed.
`true` if a blank password is allowed, otherwise `false`.
Gets or sets a permitted connection string.
Multiple connection strings may be identified.
You may also provide additional connection string restrictions using <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OraclePermissionAttribute.KeyRestrictions%2A>.
A permitted connection string.
Returns an <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OraclePermission"></xref> object that is configured according to the attribute properties.
An <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OraclePermission"></xref> object.

Identifies whether the list of connection string parameters identified by the <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OraclePermissionAttribute.KeyRestrictions"></xref> property are the only connection string parameters allowed.
One of the <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OraclePermissionAttribute.KeyRestrictionBehavior"></xref> values.
Gets or sets connection string parameters that are allowed or disallowed.
Connection string parameters are identified in the form =.
Multiple parameters can be specified, delimited using a semicolon (;).

The connection string parameters listed may be identified as either the only additional parameters allowed or additional parameters that are not allowed using the <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OraclePermissionAttribute.KeyRestrictionBehavior%2A> property.

If no key restrictions are specified, and the <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OraclePermissionAttribute.KeyRestrictionBehavior%2A> property is set to `AllowOnly`, no additional connection string parameters are allowed.

If no key restrictions are specified, and the <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OraclePermissionAttribute.KeyRestrictionBehavior%2A> property is set to `PreventUsage`, additional connection string parameters are allowed.
If more than one rule is set for the same connection string, the more restrictive rule is selected during the permission check.
One or more connection string parameters that are allowed or disallowed.
Identifies whether the attribute should serialize the connection string.
`true` if the attribute should serialize the connection string; otherwise `false`.
Identifies whether the attribute should serialize the set of key restrictions.
`true` if the attribute should serialize the set of key restrictions, otherwise `false`.
